data.question: What is the main goal of the net-clipping approach described in the text?
data.answer: The main goal of the net-clipping approach is to deduce the topology of metalâ€“organic frameworks (MOFs) assembled from organic ligands of low symmetry, specifically those containing zigzag ligands.

data.question: How does the net-clipping approach work for predicting the topologies of MOFs?
data.answer: The net-clipping approach works by rational deconstruction of edge-transitive nets comprising higher-connected molecular building blocks (MBBs), specifically by splitting 4-connected (4-c) nodes into two 3-connected (3-c) nodes and then clipping their two diagonally connecting groups.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach can only be applied to MOFs with square-like 4-c MBBs.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the outcome of applying net-clipping to the 17 edge-transitive nets containing square-like 4-c MBBs?
data.answer: Applying net-clipping to the 17 edge-transitive nets containing square-like 4-c MBBs led to the generation of 10 nets with different underlying topologies.

data.question: How many new MOFs were synthesized using the net-clipping approach, and what was unique about them?
data.answer: Three new MOFs were synthesized using the net-clipping approach, each exhibiting the deduced topology unique to the approach.

data.question: What is the significance of the presence of a 6-cycle in the edge-transitive nets regarding net-clipping?
data.answer: The presence of a 6-cycle in the edge-transitive nets signifies a structural feature that frustrates the net clipping in a fully zigzag fashion, making it challenging to apply the approach.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach has been experimentally validated.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of 2-fluorobenzoic acid in the synthesis of Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC?
data.answer: 2-fluorobenzoic acid acted as a modulator in the synthesis of Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC, enabling the formation of the hexanuclear RE MBB in the MOF.

data.question: True or False: All derived nets from the net-clipping approach can be clipped into other nets.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the result of net-clipping the 'nbo' topology?
data.answer: Net-clipping the 'nbo' topology resulted in the 'sql' topology.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach can predict the formation of 2D nets from 3D nets.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the crystal system of the Cu-sql-3,3'-ABDC MOF?
data.answer: The crystal system of the Cu-sql-3,3'-ABDC MOF was monoclinic.

data.question: How does the coordination environment in Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC compare to that in ftw-MOF-BPTC?
data.answer: In Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC, the coordination environment of 4 carboxylates in the horizontal plane of the cluster is chelating a single atom, while in ftw-MOF-BPTC, it is bridging two metal atoms.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach is limited to predicting the topologies of MOFs with zigzag ligands only.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the role of DMF in the synthesis of Cu-sql-3,3'-ABDC?
data.answer: DMF (N,N'-dimethylformamide) was used as a solvent in the solvothermal conditions for the synthesis of Cu-sql-3,3'-ABDC.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach has contributed to the rational design of MOFs by providing insights into the assembly of less-symmetric ligands.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the significance of using single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) in the study?
data.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) was significant for determining the crystal structures of the synthesized MOFs, validating the predicted topologies from the net-clipping approach.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach can predict the formation of MOFs with distorted structures.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of using 2-fluorobenzoic acid in the synthesis of Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC?
data.answer: 2-fluorobenzoic acid was used as a modulator to enable the formation of the hexanuclear RE MBB in Tb-fcu-3,3'-BPDC.

data.question: True or False: The net-clipping approach has limitations in predicting MOF structures due to the presence of 6-cycles in some edge-transitive nets.
data.answer: True
